channel.title: shelly config on Shelly CLI
channel.description: Recent content in shelly config on Shelly CLI

item.title: shelly config edit
item.description:
shelly config edit

Open CLI config in editor

Synopsis

Open the Shelly CLI configuration file in your default editor.

The editor is determined by:

  1. ’editor’ setting in config file
  2. $EDITOR environment variable
  3. $VISUAL environment variable
  4. Falls back to common editors (nano, vim, vi)

This allows you to directly edit the configuration file, including devices, aliases, groups, scenes, and other settings.

Examples

Options

Options inherited from parent commands

SEE ALSO

  • shelly config - Manage CLI configuration

item.title: shelly config get
item.description:
shelly config get

Get a CLI configuration value

Synopsis

Get a configuration value from the Shelly CLI config file.

Use dot notation to access nested values (e.g., “defaults.timeout”). Without a key, shows all configuration values.

Examples

Options

Options inherited from parent commands

SEE ALSO

  • shelly config - Manage CLI configuration

item.title: shelly config reset
item.description:
shelly config reset

Reset CLI configuration to defaults

Synopsis

Reset the Shelly CLI configuration to default values.

This clears all custom settings from the config file. Device registrations, aliases, and other data are preserved.

Examples

Options

Options inherited from parent commands

SEE ALSO

  • shelly config - Manage CLI configuration

item.title: shelly config set
item.description:
shelly config set

Set CLI configuration values

Synopsis

Set configuration values in the Shelly CLI config file.

Use dot notation for nested values (e.g., “defaults.timeout=30s”).

Examples
